title: I love it when sylas can press W and gain 270 hp with a rank 1 spell at lvl 3
body:
Its ok tho, old aatrox had to be removed because he had "unbalanceable sustain", and that shit is on a point and click spell, you cannot outplay that, some ppl realized how broken this spell is and are maxing it first while going grasp or fleet, and hes literally 3 times more immovable than old vlad/aatrox out of lane.

This is all not mentioning the same champion has 3 dashes and a shield on top of it.

So fking stupid.

replies.body: Sylas, doesn't have decent sustain items, get your head out of your ass, and look at the items, the best ones to get tanky are pure health, which means no resistances. boohoo you can't play old aatrox, get over yourself

> [{quoted}](name=Machigainashi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-02-04T17:36:20.142+0000)
>
> Sylas, doesn't have decent sustain items, get your head out of your ass, and look at the items, the best ones to get tanky are pure health, which means no resistances. boohoo you can't play old aatrox, get over yourself

Yeah, instead he gets to build the best items in the game (mage items).

Poor sylas cant build mediocre lifesteal items!

> [{quoted}](name=Anime Fizz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-02-04T17:51:22.240+0000)
>
> Yeah, instead he gets to build the best items in the game (mage items).
> 
> Poor sylas cant build mediocre lifesteal items!

im sorry, i agree with your base point, but mage items are the best items in the game? We have 1 armor item, 1 magres item, 1 pen item (2 if you count morellos, which wastes stat efficiency on grievous wounds that you might not need), our grievous wounds item comes online later and is worse, no health from damage item anymore, our "build up a charge to do burst" items are much worse, our slow item is worse, we have no "shield enemy damage when at low health" item least of all one that can be built early.

What item do we have thats better than an AD one? Zhonyas arguably, and maybe Liandries since I dont think ADs have an equivalent item, thats about it. Theres a reason why every AP build looks more or less the same, we have to scrape up the few items that are decent for us. The defining difference tends to be whether you build Archangels Staff or not.

We used to have a lot of strong AP exclusive items like Abyssal Scepter, DFG, Will of the Ancients, but they all got complained about so much they got removed.

> [{quoted}](name=Baval,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T18:48:06.064+0000)
>
> im sorry, i agree with your base point, but mage items are the best items in the game? We have 1 armor item, 1 magres item, 1 pen item (2 if you count morellos, which wastes stat efficiency on grievous wounds that you might not need), our grievous wounds item comes online later and is worse, no health from damage item anymore, our "build up a charge to do burst" items are much worse, our slow item is worse, we have no "shield enemy damage when at low health" item least of all one that can be built early.
> 
> What item do we have thats better than an AD one? Zhonyas arguably, and maybe Liandries since I dont think ADs have an equivalent item, thats about it. Theres a reason why every AP build looks more or less the same, we have to scrape up the few items that are decent for us. The defining difference tends to be whether you build Archangels Staff or not.

{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3916}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3135}}{{item:3135}}{{item:3089}} {{item:3157}} 

AD champions wish they could have items this good.

Mage items are so op that even AP assassins have to abuse them to be viable.
Mage items are great for mages and assassins. For AP bruisers, not so much.

> [{quoted}](name=Anime Fizz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T18:54:25.971+0000)
>
> {{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3916}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3135}}{{item:3135}}{{item:3089}} {{item:3157}} 
> 
> AD champions wish they could have items this good.
> 
> Mage items are so op that even AP assassins have to abuse them to be viable.

{{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3134}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3026}} {{item:3031}} 

They don't need to wish, they already have items that are good.
This whole mythology of Mage items being busted is ridiculous.
People such as yourself are still complaining even after the reduction of AP as a whole, and the increase of base MR.

> [{quoted}](name=Anime Fizz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T18:54:25.971+0000)
>
> {{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}}{{item:3285}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3916}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3157}} 
> 
> AD champions wish they could have items this good.
> 
> Mage items are so op that even AP assassins have to abuse them to be viable.

Im sorry, AD champions wish they could have Ludens?
You had it first. {{item:3087}} and its better {{item:3095}} 

AD champions wish they could have pen boots? Thats the only flat pen item we have and also the only boots item we have. 

AD champs wish they could have %pen? No you dont, because flat pen is better in almost every situation and you have a ton of those items.

AD champs wish they could have a stat multiplier item we never build? No you dont, because infinity Edge is a stat multiplier item you DO build.

Oblivion Orb is an incomplete item with 89% gold efficiency that builds into an item with only 92% gold efficiency! What!? And more than 33% of its stat value is in health!

The only one you said thats even remotely biased for APs is Zhonyas, which I mentioned and is also debatabley worse than Maw of Malmortius which comes online faster, doesnt disable you, and buffs you.

And im sorry, is your argument that AP assassins build AP items and that makes them OP?

OK well, "AD items are so op that even AD assassins have to abuse them to be viable."
for anyone downvoting this person,  You can almost entirely negate any flat magic pen with {{item:1033}}  and I believe that builds into {{item:3111}}  so you don't even waste an item slot

{{item:3026}}  automatic, only happens when you die

{{item:3153}} :  8% current health and can apply more than once per hit for up to 16% current hp unless there' an ability that counts more than one hit at once

they have their equivalents...and now two anti-burst items, woops, three antiburst items

> [{quoted}](name=3TWarrior,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2019-02-05T04:23:27.579+0000)
>
> {{item:3026}}  automatic, only happens when you die
> 
> {{item:3153}} :  8% current health and can apply more than once per hit for up to 16% current hp unless there' an ability that counts more than one hit at once
> 
> they have their equivalents...and now two anti-burst items, woops, three antiburst items

wow i didnt even know BoTRK did that. Its %damage is much stronger. Plus gives lifesteal and is more gold efficient. AND has an active. But yeah, AP items are sooooo busted. Poor ADs i feel for them i really do.

I may need to look it up again, but it worked well on champions like Evelynn who could apply it rapidly and in quick succession.  {{champion:58}}  was another example, and he can apply it 3x in quick succession

what I was referring to though was the interaction with effects such as Rageblade that cause procs more than once

so after looking it up, evelynn has been changed but can still apply an on hit effect on her E, renekton can apply it 3x, but it says that it attacks them that many times, so it may be reduced in effectiveness because of it not applying all at once

makes me wonder how rageblade works on him.  part of the fun though is thinking of various things and testing them out

After looking that up, Rageblade does not affect abilities that proc effects.  guess it would be too powerful as you could apply 5x on renekton
That would be insane if you weren't lying. His buffed heal when he's low hp is 100 + 70% ap. I doubt the level 3 Sylas you're laning against has the 242 AP required to make his heal 270.

> [{quoted}](name=Naalith,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-02-04T19:01:32.268+0000)
>
> That would be insane if you weren't lying. His buffed heal when he's low hp is 100 + 70% ap. I doubt the level 3 Sylas you're laning against has the 242 AP required to make his heal 270.

Value is doubled when under 40% hp.

Read the tooltip fully next time.
Hey buddy, maybe you should read my comment more fully next time. 100 + 70 IS the doubled value. Ironic that you apparently did not read the heal values at all.
Hey, maybe he double leveled his W, so he only needs 143 AP to get the mythical 270 heal when below 40%. 143 AP is achievable at lvl 3, right? Right?
Yes my son, if your level 1 invade results in two pentakills that could be feasible.
What, you've never shown up to lane at 2 minutes at 10/0? Sylas is that broken, man

So he has over 200AP at lvl 3? Well, most champs are OP under that circumstance.

Not saying sylas doesn't have his flaws, but so far i really have no issue with the heal.
Now his Bullshit ult, that's another thing entierly...

> [{quoted}](name=Sire Hippington,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2019-02-04T20:17:23.298+0000)
>
> So he has over 200AP at lvl 3? Well, most champs are OP under that circumstance.
> 
> Not saying sylas doesn't have his flaws, but so far i really have no issue with the heal.
> Now his Bullshit ult, that's another thing entierly...

His ult is basically reliant on the enemy team having OP ults.
Cause there are so many weak ults in the game...especially when you can go AP heavy and convert ad ratios into AP.

You forgot to mention that Sylas also has a slow, a stun, and a knockup.

But his ult ranges anywhere from literally useless when facing Udyr or another Sylas to OP when facing an opponent with a strong ult that doesn't depend on kit synergy (Karthus, Soraka, Janna, TF, etc.). He's not balanceable.
Hes fun af tho, have you played him?

> [{quoted}](name=Wublerdude,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2019-02-04T19:51:15.333+0000)
>
> Hes fun af tho, have you played him?

I don't doubt that a champion with three dashes, a shield, a heal, a slow, a stun, a knockup, and five different ults every game is very fun to play in terms of having so many bells and whistles to paw at, but he's still a cookie-cutter shirtless husbando with an overloaded and unbalanceable kit.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=000700000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T21:34:52.481+0000)
>
> I don't doubt that a champion with three dashes, a shield, a heal, a slow, a stun, a knockup, and five different ults every game is very fun to play in terms of having so many bells and whistles to paw at, but he's still a cookie-cutter shirtless husbando with an overloaded and unbalanceable kit.

He has one dash, a skillshot gap closer and a 0.5 second knockup. At least get your facts right. He is far from overloaded.

> [{quoted}](name=Snake of Avarice,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=0007000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-06T08:42:23.317+0000)
>
> He has one dash, a skillshot gap closer and a 0.5 second knockup. At least get your facts right. He is far from overloaded.

Dash 1: "Kingslayer - ACTIVE: Sylas **lunges** at a target enemy..."

Dash 2: "Abscond / Abduct - FIRST CAST - ABSCOND: Sylas **dashes** forward..."

Dash 3: "Abscond / Abduct - SECOND CAST - ABDUCT: Sylas whips out his chains in the target direction, dealing magic damage and stunning the first enemy hit, **pulling himself** towards them..."

Shield: "Abscond / Abduct - FIRST CAST - ABSCOND: Sylas ... **shields himself** for 2 seconds."

Heal: "Kingslayer - ACTIVE: ... Against enemy champions, Sylas is **healed**, doubled if he's below 40% health."

Slow 1: "Chain Lash - ACTIVE: ... **slowing** enemies hit for 2 seconds. ..."

Slow 2, actually: "Chain Lash - ACTIVE: ... After a 0.5-seconds delay, ... **slows** enemies hit by 50% for 2 seconds."

Stun: "Abscond / Abduct - SECOND CAST - ABDUCT: Sylas whips out his chains in the target direction, dealing magic damage and **stunning** the first enemy hit,..."

Knockup: "Abscond / Abduct - SECOND CAST - ABDUCT: Sylas whips out his chains ... **knocking them up** for 0.5 seconds upon arrival."

Five ults: I don't think I need a quote for this one.

However, I will fully admit that I've been playing this overloaded abomination of a kit and enjoying the heck out of it (except when I steal Udyr's R which is NOT AN ULT, Riot...). I'm just not sure if he's worth buying when he'll almost certainly be gutted in a few weeks/months after revenue flattens. And, as I said, there's the fact that he's a cookie-cutter husbando, which Riot seems to enjoy cranking out these days.
a small, skillshot tiny weak slow, and a .75 stun/knockup, but yeah, lets complain about his cc.
He is busted and once ppl learns how to play him we will all beg for Sylas nerfs

the highest healing he'd get at lvl 1 on just his Kingslayer with grasp domination would be around 190. keep in mind he'd have to have runes dedicated to playing around his kingslayer as much as possible and a fully completed eyeball collection at lvl 1 somehow.

Honestly i don't think your team giving him like 2 pentas before the game even starts has to be what he's balanced around. but hey you got free updoots.
Except Sylas doesn't have anywhere near the bulk as Aatrox, nor can he properly itemize to abuse high healing and high durability.

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-02-04T17:30:40.435+0000)
>
> Except Sylas doesn't have anywhere near the bulk as Aatrox, nor can he properly itemize to abuse high healing and high durability.

Bulk? Old aatrox was as squishy as a ranged champion to make up for his sustain, sylas has high base stats compared to him.

no hoo hoo hoo he has the lowest ad in the game so low riot had to buff his ad while old aatrox gets a free bf sword or something after full bloodwell. if we are comparing champs thats the big difference there. not to mention he loses vs hard duelists that love to auto.(yi jax udyr)
syals is trash. like seriously, but laning against him has to be the most tilting shit ever. It's very fucking annoying esp if they have aftershock

Hmmmm it's almost like one is mana-gated and the other had this massive amount of built in sustain as a passive on a regular skill and this sustain wasn't at all reduced on minions before....interesting.
Meanwhile he can't heal from minions and has to always put himself in danger to try and heal and HOPE he gets away with more HP than before.

Just had a Sylas in my game who was tolerable throughout most of the game, but near the end he literally started oneshotting me and somehow ended up with more kills than me, even though I was the fed one previously with Dark Harvest and all he had was fucking Electrocute with a full AP build. Oh well, we still won.

Electrocute does more damage that DH at every stage of the game until you have 40 stacks. Just sayin. And its Bonus AD ratio is better with the AP ratio Staying the same. As well as it being adaptive damage, if you were an AD champ his damage will always be better into late game due to to fact that all champs have better armor growth than MR growth. And armor is on more of the common items

> [{quoted}](name=DiscWizard1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2019-02-05T01:03:24.361+0000)
>
> Electrocute does more damage that DH at every stage of the game until you have 40 stacks. Just sayin. And its Bonus AD ratio is better with the AP ratio Staying the same. As well as it being adaptive damage, if you were an AD champ his damage will always be better into late game due to to fact that all champs have better armor growth than MR growth. And armor is on more of the common items

I often get close to 30 DH at the end of the game.
He does like 0 dmg tho so that's an ok trade off

he has a low winrate  40% so its balanced at least let him keep this heal in close combat. its so satisfying to gut punch a veigar mid lane to heal then he flashes quickly after i dark harvested him with q.

> [{quoted}](name=Corrector1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-02-04T18:36:21.920+0000)
>
> he has a low winrate  40% so its balanced at least let him keep this heal in close combat. its so satisfying to gut punch a veigar mid lane to heal then he flashes quickly after i dark harvested him with q.

... He was just released. Idiots are still trying to play him cause he's new and they probably saw someone 1v9. His true playerbase will reveal itself over time and show his true potential and weaknesses.

if he didn't have it, he'd be trash. Unlike ad bruisers, he being an ap bruiser, does not have any sustain he can optimally build. So, he has to get it in his kit. If he didn't have a significant heal, he'd be worse than he already is.
While this post is probably hyperbole his sustain is pretty ridiculous.

> [{quoted}](name=JamesTheMage15,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gxQeElPl,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2019-02-04T21:59:10.455+0000)
>
> While this post is probably hyperbole his sustain is pretty ridiculous.

Sadly its not, i saw the green +270 text with my own eyes.

Granted, his W was probably rank 2 and it is combined with grasp healing and taste of blood/ravenous hunter, but its still completely abusrd.

Yeah, that heal is one of the only things Sylas has going for him.

The guy does very little damage for a mage.

Seems like a problem with mage items rather than Sylas?
Mages are far from the problem with this game..

Old Aatrox was fair because you could zone him off the wave to stop his healing.

But low elo players don't understand how to do that, so they think he has no "counterplay".

Had 2 skillshots btw.
absolutely insane mechanics lad
